text:
Zapata Computing is a great place, I’d recommend to anybody!  They have offices in Boston & Toronto, as well as remote people spread all over the world.
Note, full disclosure, while there is movement to Julia at Zapata, there is a lot of stuff still done in Python,
and this postdoc position would involve a lot of work in Python.
<https://zapata.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=89>

attachments.title: Industry Postdoc - jointly with University of Toronto and Zapata Computing
attachments.text: About the position: We seek an exceptional researcher for a two-year industry postdoc position in the group of Alán Aspuru-Guzik at the University of Toronto and jointly with Zapata Computing. You will be the principal researcher in a three-way-collaboration with the University of Toronto, a Fortune 500
attachments.fallback: Industry Postdoc - jointly with University of Toronto and Zapata Computing

text:
Thanks for posting! I've been lurking on a few quantum computing websites for this sort of opportunity.

Just wondering around the website and I love this news article:
<https://www.zdnet.com/article/quantum-computing-now-is-a-bit-like-sql-was-in-the-late-80s-wild-and-wooly-and-full-of-promise-says-zapatas-ceo/>

attachments.title: Quantum computing now is a bit like SQL was in the late 80s: Wild and wooly and full of promise | ZDNet
attachments.text: Just thinking you will drop this shiny new thing called quantum into your data center is naive.
attachments.fallback: ZDNet: Quantum computing now is a bit like SQL was in the late 80s: Wild and wooly and full of promise | ZDNet

text: <@U01DTN55KK4> I hope to hear that you’ve applied!

elements.text: I hope to hear that you’ve applied!

text: I'm in the middle of applying! If you have time I'd be keen to message you and hear about your experience at Zapata / in the quantum startup sphere. I'm actually completely on the fence about whether to pursue academic or industrial jobs so these industry postdoc crossover positions seem quite tempting :wink:

text: Sure!  Feel free to message me.  Zapata definitely has a very strong academic bent, reminds me of when I was at MIT!
